DerelictSDLNet

DerelictSDLNet is a D binding to Sam Lantinga's SDL_net, a cross-platform networking library designed to be used together with SDL.

The current version of DerelictSDLNet requires SDL_net 1.2.7 or later.

Building

To compile DerelictSDLNet, add the DerelictSDLNet make target to the command line when compiling Derelict. For example, to build DerelictSDLNet on Windows with DMD, you would execute the following: 

make -fwin32.mak DerelictSDLNet DC=DMD
For more information on compiling Derelict libraries, see Building the Derelict Bindings.

Using

  1. Always make sure the DerelictSDLNet source modules are available on your import path.
  2. In modules that make use of DerelictSDLNet, you will need to import the derelict.sdl.net and derelict.sdl.sdl modules.
  3. You must link your application with the DerelictSDL, DerelictSDLNet and DerelictUtil libraries.
  4. Before calling any SDL_net functions, you need to make a call to DerelictSDLNet.load(). This will load the shared library.

The following is a complete program that loads DerelictSDLNet: 


import derelict.sdl.net;

void main()
{
    DerelictSDLNet.load();

    // now you can call SDL_net functions
}

As with other Derelict bindings, DerelictSDLNet will throw an exception if an error occurs while loading the shared library. For more information on Derelict exceptions, see the documentation for Using the Derelict Bindings.

Finally, the method DerelictSDLNet.unload() is provided for convenience. In normal practice you do not need to call this function, as Derelict will unload the library automatically when the app exits. You generally should only use this function if you need to unload DerelictSDLNet while the application is running or if you disable the automatic unloading of shared libraries (as per the documentation for the loader module).
